paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene in the context of Familial Amyloidotic Polyneuropathy (FAP) and evaluates the effects of doxycycline and TUDCA treatments in mouse models. It mentions the TTR V30M variant but does not provide specific variant notations or penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: TTR deposition as amyloid, Congo red (CR)-positive material

individual_records.evidence_sentence: These animals were previously analyzed in our laboratory and ~60% of the animals over 1 year of age were found to have TTR deposition as amyloid, i.e., Congo red (CR)-positive material.

functional_data.summary: Doxycycline was shown to disaggregate amyloid deposits in TTR V30M transgenic mice.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in the TTR V30M transgenic mouse model.
variants.additional_notes: The study primarily focuses on the effects of treatments rather than detailed genetic variant analysis.
key_quotes: TTR V30M is the most common TTR mutation associated with FAP.
These animals were previously analyzed in our laboratory and ~60% of the animals over 1 year of age were found to have TTR deposition as amyloid.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the TTR gene and its implications in FAP.
